table_with_only_examples:
{| class="wikitable "
|-
! '''Name of Charity''' || '''Location of Charity''' || '''Accusers''' || '''Description'''
|-
| [[Al-Haramain Foundation]]<ref name=CsrtAlMari>[http://wid.ap.org/documents/detainees/jamalmari.pdf Dossier (.pdf)]{{Dead link|date=September 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} of [[Jamal Muhammad Alawi Mar'i]], ''[[Combatant Status Review Tribunal]]''</ref> || {{Flag|Saudi Arabia}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States Department of State.svg}} [[United States Department of State|U.S. State Department]] || 
* Suspicion fell on Guantanamo detainee [[Jamal Muhammad Alawi Mar'i]], in part, because he was a volunteer for Al Haramain
|-
| [[Al Kifah Refugee Center]]<ref name="Cnn021208"/> || {{Flag|United States}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of Spain.svg}} Spanish police ||
* Alleged to have served as a covert funnel for US support of those resisting the [[Soviet–Afghan War]].<ref name="CoopResearch">[http://www.cooperativeresearch.org/timeline.jsp?timeline=complete_911_timeline Complete 911 Timeline] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060427080215/http://www.cooperativeresearch.org/timeline.jsp?timeline=complete_911_timeline|date=2006-04-27}}, ''[[Cooperative Research]]''</ref>
* Alleged to have trained fighters destined to serve in [[Afghanistan]] under [[Osama bin Laden]].<ref name="CoopResearch"/>
* Alleged to have provided military and demolition training to those who bombed the [[World Trade Center (1973–2001)|World Trade Center]] in 1993.<ref name="CoopResearch"/>
|-
| [[Al Wafa al Igatha al Islamia]]<ref name="CsrtAlMari"/> || {{Flag|Afghanistan}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States Department of State.svg}} [[United States Department of State|U.S. State Department]] || 
* Suspicion fell on Guantanamo detainee [[Jamal Muhammad Alawi Mar'i]], in part, because he was a volunteer for Al Wafa
|-
| [[Benevolence International Foundation]] || {{Flag|United States}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.svg}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] || 
* Alleged to have helped fund the [[1993 World Trade Center bombing]].
* Placed on the [[Terrorist exclusion list]].<ref name="Exclude"/>
|-
| [[Global Relief Foundation]] || {{Flag|United States}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.svg}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]||
* Bosnian offices shut down on US request in 2002
* Commission of the [[European Union]] froze assets in 2006<ref>[http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/site/en/oj/2006/l_012/l_01220060118en00070016.pdf Commission Regulation 76/2006]</ref>
|-
| [[Holy Land Foundation for Relief and Development]]<ref name=Wildman>[http://www.wildmanharrold.com/about/press/teendeath120704.htm Charities Held Liable in Teen Death] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.today/20061114091539/http://www.wildmanharrold.com/about/press/teendeath120704.htm |date=2006-11-14 }}, Wildman Harrold Attorneys and Counselors</ref><ref name=NYT>[http://topics.nytimes.com/top/reference/timestopics/organizations/h/holy_land_foundation_for_relief_and_development/index.html Holy Land Foundation for Relief and Development, NY Times]</ref> || {{Flag|United States}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.svg}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]||
* On November 10, 2004, convicted by [[Federal judiciary of the United States|US federal court]] of funding [[Hamas]]. In 2001 it was the largest Muslim charity in the United States.
|-
| [[IHH (Turkish NGO)|İnsan Hak ve Hürriyetleri ve İnsani Yardım Vakfı]] || {{Flag|Turkey}} || {{Flag|Russia}}<ref>{{cite web |last1=Winter |first1=Chase |title=Russia claims Turkish NGOs are 'main supplier' of extremists in Syria |url=http://www.dw.com/en/russia-claims-turkish-ngos-are-main-supplier-of-extremists-in-syria/a-19159685 |website=DW |access-date=20 May 2021}}</ref>||
* Alleged to have sent weapons and supplies to extremists in Syria during the [[Syrian Civil War]].
|-
| [[International Islamic Relief Organization]]<ref name="Cnn021208"/> || {{Flag|Saudi Arabia}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States Department of State.svg}} [[United States Department of State|U.S. State Department]]||
* Sued by families of the victims of the [[September 11 attacks]] |}
tables_without_examples:
{| class="wikitable " |- ! '''Name of Charity''' || '''Location of Charity''' || '''Accusers''' || '''Description''' |- | [[Interpal]][http://www.ots.treas.gov/_files/48937.html "U.S. Designates Five Charities Funding Hamas and Six Senior Hamas Leaders as Terrorist Entities"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721024711/http://www.ots.treas.gov/_files/48937.html |date=2011-07-21 }}, [[United States Department of the Treasury]], August 22, 2003. || {{Flag|United Kingdom}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States Department of the Treasury.png}} [[United States Treasury Department]] || * Accusation by US Treasury Department (2003) * British government's [[Charity Commission for England and Wales]] (2003) found no evidence to support allegations of connection to terrorism.Matthew Levitt, Dennis Ross, ''Hamas: Politics, Charity, And Terrorism in the Service of Jihad, Yale University Press,'' 2007, [https://books.google.com/books?id=CG-AjU3rraQC&pg=PA158 p. 158], {{ISBN|0300122586}}, 9780300122589 *(Note: in 1997 ''[[Sunday Telegraph]]'' retracted accusations Interpal was run by [[Hamas]] activists{{Citation needed|date=April 2012}}; in 2003 the [[Board of Deputies of British Jews]] repeated such allegations, retracting them after it was sued by Interpal;Dominic Casciani, [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/3135392.stm Islamic charity cleared of Hamas link], [[BBC]], 24 September 2003. in 2010 ''[[Sunday Express]]'' issued an apology and made an out-of-court settlement for libel for making similar allegations.{{cite news |url=http://www.civilsociety.co.uk/governance/news/content/7042/interpal_wins_high_court_case_against_sunday_express_claims_of_terror_links |title=Interpal wins High Court case against Sunday Express claims of terror links |author=Niki May Young |date=27 July 2010 |publisher=Civil Society Media |access-date=19 August 2010}}) |- | [[Internationale Humanitäre Hilfsorganisation e.V.]]{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/germany-outlaws-ihh-over-claimed-hamas-links-1.301483|title=Germany outlaws IHH over claimed Hamas links, Haaretz 12.07.10|date=12 July 2010|work=Haaretz.com|access-date=23 October 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3918670,00.html|title=Germany bans group accused of Hamas links, Ynet 07.12.10|work=ynet|date=12 July 2010 |access-date=23 October 2014}} | {{Flag|Germany}} |{{Flagicon image|Flag of Germany.svg}} [[Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community|German Interior Ministry]] | * Outlawed in Germany since it has financially supported Hamas, while presenting activities to donors as humanitarian help. |- | [[Islamic Relief]] | {{Flag|United Kingdom}} |{{Flag|Israel}},{{cite news|title=Israel bans UK-based Muslim charity accused of funding Hamas|url=http://reuters.com/article/uk-palestinians-israel-charities-idUKKBN0EU1FE20140619|website=Reuters|date=19 June 2014 }}
{{Flag|United Arab Emirates}}{{cite web|author=Simeon Kerr |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/09e13dee-6db8-11e4-bf80-00144feabdc0.html#axzz3M164VOMY |title=UAE blacklists 83 groups as terrorists |website=FT.com |date=2014-11-16 |access-date=2016-04-10}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/news/uk/article4270669.ece |title=Charity banned over 'links to terrorism' |newspaper=[[The Times]] |date=2014-11-18 |access-date=2016-04-10}}
{{Flag|Germany}}{{cite web|title=Islamic Relief hat Kontakte zur Muslimbruderschaft|url=https://www.fr.de/politik/islamic-relief-hat-kontakte-zur-muslimbruderschaft-zr-12196714.html|website=Frankfurter Rundschau|date=16 April 2019 }} | *Alleged to have funded [[Hamas]] and alleged connections to [[Muslim Brotherhood]]. Islamic Relief is contesting the Israeli allegations{{Cite web|date=2020-07-27|title=Islamic Relief to contest Israeli 'terrorism' allegations in court|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jul/27/islamic-relief-to-contest-israeli-terrorism-allegations-in-court|access-date=2021-10-25|website=the Guardian|language=en}} and publicly refutes any alleged links to the Muslim Brotherhood.{{Cite web|title=UAE's tolerance embraces faiths, runs up against politics|url=https://apnews.com/article/muslim-brotherhood-pope-francis-ap-top-news-international-news-united-arab-emirates-977d548fdf56424c8a9f027a3d816e20|access-date=2021-10-25|website=AP NEWS|date=2 February 2019 |language=en}} |- | [[Jamaat al Dawa al Quran]][{{DoD detainees ARB|Set_30_2048-2144.pdf#16}} Summarized transcripts (.pdf)], from [[Sahib Rohullah Wakil]]'s ''[[Combatant Status Review Tribunal]]'' - pages 16-25 || {{Flag|Afghanistan}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States.svg}} [[JTF-GTMO]] || * American counter-terrorism analysts at Guantanamo assert this group is an extremist militant group. |- | [[Maktab al-Khidamat]][http://www.9-11commission.gov/report/911Report_App.htm National Commission on Terrorist Attack Upon the United States: appendix a common abbreviations], ''[[9/11 Commission]]'' || {{Flag|Afghanistan}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States.svg}} [[9/11 Commission]]|| * Alleged to have been transformed by [[Osama bin Laden]] into [[al Qaeda]]. |- | [[Muslim Aid]] || {{Flag|United Kingdom}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of Spain.svg}} [[Law enforcement in Spain|Spanish police]],{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2002/WORLD/europe/12/08/spain.alqaeda/|title=CNN.com - Spain charity terror link alleged - Dec. 8, 2002|access-date=23 October 2014}}
{{Flag|Israel}},{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.il/mfa/pressroom/2008/pages/defense%20minister%20signs%20order%20banning%20hamas-affiliated%20charitable%20organizations%207-jul-2008.aspx|title=Defense Minister signs order banning Hamas-affiliated charitable organizations|work=GxMSDev|access-date=23 October 2014}}
{{Flag|Bangladesh}}{{cite web|url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/newDesign/news-details.php?nid=80287|title=NGOs under scanner for 'funding militancy'|access-date=23 October 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/politics/2014/apr/06/hasina-no-vote-rigging-al-backed-candidates|title=Hasina: No vote rigging by AL-backed candidates - Dhaka Tribune|access-date=23 October 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/law-amp-rights/2013/aug/21/government-mulls-banning-10-islamist-outfits|title=Ten Islamist outfits to face ban - Dhaka Tribune|access-date=23 October 2014}} || * Alleged to have funded [[mujahideen|mujahideen fighters]] to [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]], [[Union of Good]], [[Islamism|Islamist militants]] of Bangladesh. |}

{| class="wikitable "
|-
! '''Name of Charity''' || '''Location of Charity''' || '''Accusers''' || '''Description'''
|-
| [[Society of the Revival of Islamic Heritage]]<ref name=CsrtAlDaihaniPg25>[http://wid.ap.org/documents/detainees/fenaitelaldaihani.pdf Summary of Evidence (.pdf)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130504002031/http://wid.ap.org/documents/detainees/fenaitelaldaihani.pdf |date=2013-05-04 }} from pages 25-26 of [[Mohammed Fenaitel Mohamed Al Daihani]]'s [[Combatant Status Review Tribunal]] </ref>|| {{Flag|Kuwait}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the United States Department of State.svg}} [[United States Department of State|U.S. State Department]]|| 
* Appears on the [[United States State Department list of Foreign Terrorist Organizations]]
|-
|[[Popular Front of India]]
|{{Flag|India}}
|{{Flagicon image|Flag of India.svg}} [[Law enforcement in India|Various Indian authorities]]
|
* Accused of Radical Islamism, [[Islamic terrorism]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/karnataka/state-has-begun-process-to-ban-pfi-sdpi-and-similar-outfits-bommai/article30591713.ece|title=PFI India's Number One Terrorist Organisation, Says Former Mumbai Police Officer|date=2015-11-28|website=HuffPost India|language=en|access-date=2019-08-17}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/karnataka/state-has-begun-process-to-ban-pfi-sdpi-and-similar-outfits-bommai/article30591713.ece|title=Ban PFI, India's no 1 terror organisation: Former Maharashtra cop|date=2016-02-23|website=Hindustan Times|language=en|access-date=2019-08-17}}</ref>
|-
| [[Tamils Rehabilitation Organisation]](TRO)<ref name=TRO>{{Cite news|title= 'Charities' back terror, Ottawa Sun }}</ref> || {{Flag|Canada}}|| {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.svg}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]|| 
* [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] |}

Holy Land Foundation for Relief and Development
İnsan Hak ve Hürriyetleri ve İnsani Yardım Vakfı
